intro: Brassica oleracea stirps caulorapa, commonly known as cauliflower, is a biennial plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, white curd made up of undeveloped flower buds, which is the edible part of the plant. The plant typically grows to a height of 50–100 cm, with thick, waxy leaves that are usually green in color. It thrives in cool climates and requires a long growing season to develop properly. Cauliflower is a cultivar that has been selectively bred for its unique head formation and is widely cultivated for both culinary and nutritional purposes.
